comments.body:
I agree for Polylines. But as the method is also inherited by Polygons. A multipolygon with holes may return LatLng[][][]. See examples of Multipolygon: http://leafletjs.com/reference-1.3.0.html#polygon
Or can we have different return types for the getLatLngs() method for Polylines and Polygons?

For now it is the best result with less work. We can't inherit from Polyline when we want to make it exact. What do you think @alejo90? Should we make it exact and introduce other interfaces or classes that even do not exists - just for extending? Should we not extend from Polyline and "rewrite" Polygon without extending from Polyline? Or should we simply solve it with this PR?
Can you apply the CrossOrigin type also to the other occurrences?

Yep, no problem. The only other place I could find it in the Leaflet documentation was in `TileLayer`:
https://leafletjs.com/reference-1.4.0.html#tilelayer-crossorigin

I've updated that interface now.
@atd-schubert Does this PR look okay now?
Any reason to `export` the type? Might make it a bit cleaner an API to leave it hidden.

I was under the impression that all types should to be exported even if it seems unnecessary based on this documentation: https://github.com/Microsoft/dtslint/blob/master/docs/strict-export-declare-modifiers.md. If I run `npm run lint leaflet` after making the change to this:
```ts
type CrossOrigin = boolean | string;
```

I get the following output:
```
$ npm run lint leaflet

> definitely-typed@0.0.3 lint /my/path/Documents/dev/DefinitelyTyped
> dtslint types "leaflet"

Error: /my/path/Documents/dev/DefinitelyTyped/types/leaflet/index.d.ts:552:6
ERROR: 552:6  strict-export-declare-modifiers  All declarations in this module are exported automatically. Prefer to explicitly write 'export' for clarity. If you have a good reason not to export this declaration, add 'export {}' to the module to shut off automatic exporting. See: https://github.com/Microsoft/dtslint/blob/master/docs/strict-export-declare-modifiers.md

    at /my/path/Documents/dev/DefinitelyTyped/node_modules/dtslint/bin/index.js:160:19
    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
    at fulfilled (/my/path/Documents/dev/DefinitelyTyped/node_modules/dtslint/bin/index.js:5:58)
    at <anonymous>
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! definitely-typed@0.0.3 lint: `dtslint types "leaflet"`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the definitely-typed@0.0.3 lint script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /my/path/.npm/_logs/2019-02-13T01_15_08_050Z-debug.log
```

Based on the error I think I would have to turn automatic exporting off for the whole module, which seems like it should be discussed in a separate issue.
My bad, didnâ€™t catch that requirement!
